proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.login

Class SingletonLoginHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.login.SingletonLoginHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RequestListener

    public class SingletonLoginHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements RequestListener
    SingletonLoginHandler is the class that checks, wether the username and password the user has input is valid, and then generates the encoding that is needed to authenticate requests. It is a singleton, to ensure that only one LoginData exists at a time.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SingletonLoginHandler getInstance()
                                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns the instance of the SingletonLoginHandler.
        Returns:
        the instance of the SingletonLoginHandler
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If instance has not yet been initialized, so if no valid username and password has been given yet.

      • getInstance

        public static SingletonLoginHandler getInstance(java.lang.String username,
                                java.lang.String password)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        If there already exists an instance of the SingletonLoginHandler, just returns that instance. (And tells you, on System.err. that you should not have called this method, but the one without parameters Else calls testPassword(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) to check the username and password. If they are valid, constructs the instance of the SingeltonLoginHandler and sets the encoding, otherwise throws the Exception that occured during testPassword.
        Parameters:
        username - the username input by the user
        password - the password input by the user
        Returns:
        the instance of the SingletonLoginHandler
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The Exception that occured during testPassword

      • update

        public void update(RequestEvent message,
          RequestNotifier notifier)
        This method is used to get the Exception that occurred during the small request in testPassword. If the updates from the RequestHandler contain an exception, it sets the errorMessage to the message of that exception.
        Specified by:
        update in interface RequestListener
        Parameters:
        message - The RequestEvent describing the current state of the RequestNotifier
        notifier - The notifier itself; not needed by this implementation; still included, since it is defined in the interface.

      • getEncoding

        public static java.lang.String getEncoding()
                                    throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns the encoding needed to authenticate requests.
        Returns:
        the encoding needed to authenticate requests.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if instance has not yet been set, so if no valid username and password has been input yet.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        This method sets instance to null. If it already is null, throws a NullPointerException. Used to log the user out.

      • hasInstance

        Returns a boolean indicating whether instance is not null.

        True if instance has been set, false if it is null.

      • buildEncoding

        public static java.lang.String buildEncoding(java.lang.String username,
                             java.lang.String password)
        Builds the encoding out of the username and the password. It does NOT set the encoding; this can only be done by getInstance(java.lang.String, java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        username -
        password -
        Returns:
        The encoding built out of the username and password
